posts.title: Notes II
posts.excerpt: Sacred Mount Shasta channels energy into the earth. The native Wintu made pilgrimages to take care of it, and only medicine men or women were allowed to climb up. We then receive an astral message, as we listen to the rain pouring down during a summer storm in Cape Romain, South Carolina, and travel over …

posts._title: Renato Castellani – Questi fantasmi AKA Ghosts – Italian Style (1967)
posts.title: Questi fantasmi
posts.excerpt: Plot:Questi fantasmi is based on what was a very popular play by Eduardo De Filippo. In fact, so popular that it was filmed three times during the ’50s and ’60s. The version uploaded here was the latter of these three adaptations, directed by Renato Castellani, and starring Vittorio Gassman and Sophia Loren in the principal …

posts.title: Die Tomorrow
posts.excerpt: Are you afraid of death? According to statistics, two people on earth die each second. Die Tomorrow zeroes in on the last day of its protagonists, each of whom have no idea of their fate. The film picks up on six everyday situations and turns them into moving stories. With true lightness of touch, director …

posts.title: Fyrtøjet
posts.excerpt: The first animated feature film made in Europe.

posts._title: Dino Risi – Pane, amore e… aka Scandal in Sorrento (1955)
posts.title: Pane, amore e…
posts.excerpt: In this Italian romantic comedy set in the town of Sorrento, on the beautiful Bay of Naples, a woman rents a home from a dashing womanizer. Unfortunately, after 30 years away, the man returns to become the town police chief and wants to reclaim his home. The woman refuses to leave. The man then attempts …

posts.title: Workingman’s Death
posts.excerpt: Quote:A look at what people from different countries suffer in order to have a job. Includes a coal miner in the Ukraine, a slaughterhouse worker in Nigeria, a sulfur miner in Indonesia, a steel worker in China, and a ship-breaker in Pakistan.

posts.title: Gaslight (1944)
posts.excerpt: SynopsisAfter the death of her famous opera-singing aunt, Paula (Ingrid Bergman) is sent to study in Italy to become a great opera singer as well. posts.title: Madame L’Eau
posts.excerpt: IDFA Synopsis :A number of farmers – Jean Rouch’s actors who more or less play themselves – is looking for a simple and cheap way to irrigate their farmland. posts.title: Petits Arrangements avec les Morts
posts.excerpt: SynopsisA dramatic triptych offering differing perspectives about death and its aftermath, set on a Brittany beach during the late summer… L’histoire d’un chateau de sable, de celui qui le construit et de ceux qui l’observent sur une plage de Bretagne. posts._title: Laurence Olivier – The Chronicle History of King Henry the Fifth with His Battell Fought at Agincourt in France AKA Henry V (1944)
posts.title: The Chronicle History of King Henry the Fifth with His Battell Fought at Agincourt in France
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Laurence Olivier’s adaptation of Henry V is one of the finest Shakespeare films ever made, full of rousing action, beautiful colors and passionate performances. Henry V is the story of the newly crowned king of England who fights the French for possession of Normandy. Olivier’s direction is inventive, beginning the film as if it were …
